page.title: 15CLOTHES:FRANCISCAN NUNS
page.content: The large robes that the nuns wear are called habits.The habit is brown and made in the shape of a cross.Over the habit they wear a Scapula -so called because it is worn over the shoulders like a yoke(yoked together with Christ). The Scapula has a red cross on it which represents the blood when Jesus died on the cross.On their heads they wear a white cloth called a wimple.The wimple covers their all their hair beacause in the olden days when people married they covered their hair, as hair was seen as a sign of beauty.Once married it is no longer necessary to be beautiful!. The nuns wear large,brown caps over the wimple. The sisters wear brown sandals in the tradition of Pilgrims.
